content.detailedDescription:
My wife, son, and myself were on our deck the night of 6-21-09 enjoying our fire pit.. we were watching the sky and enjoying the beautiful evening...We noticed several aircraft crossing the sky in different directions and also a couple of sats. going from south to north...It had been a few minutes when my wife and i at almost the same time noticed another light approach from the north headed south, and made the comment here comes another plane !   at that moment, the light stopped, became super bright, dimmed and then moved off to the southeast behind the treeline with a much smaller object following at a consistent distance....

we saw it again on 7-25-09, higer in the sky this night, suddenly appearing in the east, getting brighter, then accelerating out of sight...
content.summary: Appeared in n.E. to e., stopped became really bright, dimmed and then moved on to south

content.detailedDescription: Taking a break at work and looking up and as i did i spotted a very fast moving star like object, very bright, which was in the clear for about 4 or 5 seconds and dissappered from sight. unbelievably fast. as high as the stars.
content.summary: Fast walker going west to east

content.detailedDescription:
I was sitting on the front porch of my daughter's house, app. 10 miles north of albany on hwy. 283.  i have taken many pictures of the evening skies from this same vantage point, but have never seen this particular "line" in the sky--it did not change over a period of 10 minutes or so, it just got too dark to see.  am an avid watcher of ufo hunters, & i remember a show about "tunnels" or something similar.  i realize that this is probably one of those easily explained things, but i would rather send this in & it not be anything than have it the other way around.  if it is possible, could you email me to let me know what this is?
i did see an object when i was about 10 yrs.Old in visalia, ca,( that would be about l957).  it was a glowing rather bright green ball that came across the sky from west to east.  can still see it in my mind, i think i have been looking ever since for another one!  thanks--
content.summary: Not an object, just a strange "division line" in  the evening sky

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were fishing on the susquehanna river,when we notice one sphere north east of us.It was moving from north east to south west,at a very slow rate of speed.There were some thunder heads forming,that i was worried about and watching,that made me see the spheres.And it was up at that height.About 25,000 feet rough guess.It stopped and then that's when we saw 5 others to our south west,about the same height.They flew very slowly and then after about 25 min ,one after another just winked out.I finally see something and i don't have a camera.
content.summary: Saw 6 glowing spheres

content.detailedDescription: I was with my mom when it happened. she was on a businesstrip in sunne, sweden. i'm not sure about the date, but i am pretty sure it was the end of july, 2006. we were staying at the "selma lagerl���f spa & hotell". when the time was maybe... 10.45pm i went back to our room. my mom was still downstairs talking with some friends. i think our room was on the 4th floor. i'm sure it was the top floor, but i can't remember how many floors there were. i undressed and got ready to go to bed. but, wanting to see the stars, which i love, i went out on the balcony and looked up in the sky. the first thing i noticed was 3 lights, much more powerful than the stars. they were shaped in a perfect triangle and they were colored... i think there was two white and one red. however, the red light was switching all the time. in a random or advanced pattern, the red light switched positions all the time, maybe one switch per second. of course, a white light took it's previous place. i looked amazed at the sky, because i have always loved ufo:s, science and the paranormal. i had goosebumps all over, my heart was pounding and i felt really happy. i ran for my cellphone with camera and tried to film it. but cellphones aren't so good at filming the nightsky with, and i couldn't see anything on it. instead, i looked at the time. it was 11.02pm. that i can remember perfectly. as first i had seen the triangle, i thought it was a ufo. i tried to make it look like something else. but a plane moves, this one was standing perfectly still. a plane has different lights, with simplr patterns and other colors. a tower needs... a tower. and there was no such tower beneath it. a helicopter makes noise, this was noiseless. so i finally came to the conclusion that this was a ufo or something that looked very much like it. i watched it for maybe 5 minutes, but it didn't do anything at all. so, i went to bed. but i was truly happy, because i felt that maybe they weren't moving because the lights were a message for me or that they were watching me.
content.summary: A triangular object hovered above our hotel

content.detailedDescription: Oops.  here's the newest one
content.summary: Redo of light ships -- wrong video uploaded first time

content.detailedDescription: More light ships showed up in the area.  many appearing out of nowhere in the sky and traveling for a bit, sometimes pulsating and then fading or just simply passing overhead.  i filmed one.  they were extremely high up and never really came too close (that i'm aware of).  i'm using a sony hd camera with super night shot plus in order to be able to get them on camera so high up.
content.summary: Several light ships show up - filmed one

content.detailedDescription:
I went outside at about 10.38 pm because apparantly there were going to be shooting stars that night. after a minute or two i noticed a bright blue light above the opposite hill. i assumed it was a light in a house.
after a while i realized it couldnt be on the house, it was too high and it just didnt look right.
it started to move in a straight line in my direction and as it came closer i noticed two things-
what i could see was a bright blue light, sphere shaped.
also the noise this thing was emmitting, it was like heavy machinery, a drill perhaps.
this was all very strange so i ran inside to get a torch, to have a better look. i couldn't find one so i went back out, but by this time the ufo was almost gone. i could still see and hear it though. after about 15 seconds, it was gone.
i was eager to find out what it could be, the glowing blue light(which didnt blink btw) and strange,grinding,sound had got me thinking this wasnt any normal aircraft.
when i went back inside i felt quite scared, i thought maybe an alien was coming to get me!
content.summary: Saw it hovering above hill and as it came closer i heard a loud noise like a drill. it is a bright blue light.

content.detailedDescription: I was in bed, all of a sudden my bedroom lite up like a major  size spot lite, i put my hand in front of my eyes to block the lite, a few seconds later it vanished. no noise. i didnt pay much attention to this until a few days later , outside my house ,i have a beautiful tree, the grass is fine,my shrubs are fine ,but the soil around the tree is very dry,and every leaf on the tree is burnt to a crisp,not one branch is broken .No burn marks the tree is perfectly shaped, but every single leaf is burnt. i picked up a leaf and crushed it in my hand, to dust.
content.summary: Brightest light.

content.detailedDescription:
Sighting occurred while traveling in a car from port columbus international airport in columbus, ohio, to logan, ohio. our parking ticket was validated when leaving the airport at 5:03, and we traveled on u.S. 270 south toward wheeling. right before we exited onto st. rt. 33 to travel southeast, i noticed a strange configuration of lights in the sky. i was driving so i tried to keep my eye on it as best i could. my son saw it, too, and then he saw another from the passenger side of the car that was like the other one. we did not have a compass to get a location on these lights, but our best guess was that one was southeast and the other was northwest. later in the trip, my son saw an additional light out the back window of the car which i was unable to see while driving.

at this time of the day, it was still very dark and remained so all the way to our destination. it was a clear night until we went into dense fog for a few miles near logan. if i were to have held a ruler up to measure the object i observed from the driver's side of the car, i would estimate it to be (very) roughly 1/8" at the broad side of the shape. this particular object was the closest to us for observation.

at first, i thought it might be a helicopter just hovering. but as we drove on down the road, we would curve right and left and it allowed me to see something like a straight-on view of the object and then a side view of the object. in comparison to the stars, it looked nothing like that. these were much brighter lights. the object had three lights of different sizes stacked atop the other from what looked as though a straight on view. when seeing it as a side view, the same three stack of lights ran vertical and there was an "arm" of another line of three lights of uniform size as compared to the others which connected horizontally to the top light in the other stack in a "v" configuration. these horizontal lights were uniformly sized but didn't extend as far in length as the other arm of the "v." at times a halo effect formed a thin line proceeding further from both lines from the "v" as if there were lights glowing above a dark "edge" of the body of the object. the whole set of lights nearly completed a teardrop shape with only the "point of it missing and as if the teardrop were lying on its side with the larger, different-sized lights at the broad side of the teardrop but standing vertically from our observation point. i saw a red flash (a much smaller perfectly round light) momentarily at the apex of the "v." i had my son try to take a picture with my iphone, but with no success. he was unable to operate the google maps app on the iphone to obtain any kind of coordinate details.

the lights on the broad side which were vertical from my view were oval shaped and not of uniform size which might indicate energy propulsion? i will attempt to draw a picture of this and upload it with this report.

at times, the object on my side of the car appeared to be either higher or lower in the sky, but it hovered in the same general position all the while we drove approx. 60 miles southeast at which point we went into dense fog and it could not be seen. however, when we drove out of the fog, the one on my side of the car was still visible but we couldn't see if the other ones were still there because of the tree line. dawn was just breaking at our destination, but trees completely obscured our view of the sky there.

this is the strangest thing i have yet seen in the sky. i feel it was not a cluster of stars nor the moon partially concealed by clouds but gave the sense that it was a shaped object. the moon was perfectly visible at our destination. the object on the left side was close enough that as we went through the curves of the road that we could see something like a straight on view and a side view but how could something hover and remain in the same position from our view like that? at one point, i was mulling over in my mind whether it was keeping up us. if it were an aircraft, it would have left us behind minutes after first sighting it. we could see these objects out of both sides of the car and the back, so i don't think it could be possible to see stars that would be that uniform and clustered in opposite directions or even helicopters remaining stationery for that long so we could see them for 56.3 miles of driving distance.

as far as time is concerned, i don't feel there was any missing time, yet we left the airport at 5:03. i could not see the time on the car clock when we first observed the object due to the fact that my son had the radio playing. i looked at the car clock when we were at carroll, ohio, and it was 5:17. since my thoughts were consumed with observing this object, at this point in the trip, i first was unaware of where we were in the dark but was quite surprised when i realized we were as far along on the road as we were. according to google maps, the distance was 22 miles from the airport to carroll which they say would have taken approx. 38 minutes. it just felt as if we got to that point much faster than we ought to have. i was driving 65 on rt. 270 and 60 on rt. 33.

i compared the time on my watch to the time on an atomic clock we have in the office and my watch is off five seconds from the atomic clock. then i went out to the car and compared my watch with the car clock and found the car clock is slow by seven minutes. therefore at 5:17 on the car clock, the actual time would have been 5:24. roughly, we gained 17 minutes to that point. the clocks at our destination are not accurate, but we arrived there in the range of 5:50 to 6:10. according to google maps, the trip from the airport to our destination was 56.3 miles or 1 hour and 5 minutes. from carroll to our destination was 29.1 miles or 30 minutes. our arrival ended up in range of what was expected, but i don't know how we got to carroll as fast as we did and then arrive at the destination in the expected range. probably this was just a fluke or an error in calculation. traffic was extremely light at that time of the day on this sunday morning and at times, we were the only car visible.

the only other odd thing to report about this trip was that i would have a momentary sticking pain in the right side of my head at the top. this happened from time to time on the way home but it may not be related in any way. 

wright patterson afb is within easy flying distance of this area, so perhaps this was something of our own being tested.
content.summary: V-shaped lights observed hovering with two other clusters of lights hovering in the distance

content.detailedDescription: I woke up at approximately 3:30 am and couldn't go back to sleep (not an unusual occurrence for me). i looked at my window, and through a crack in one of the blinds, i noticed what appeared to be a very bright star. this was interesting to me, because i live in a highly populated city and i never see any stars at night (and i have looked). i looked at my window and there was a very bright, small object that looked quite far up in the sky. when i saw it through my window, i thought it was a star, but when i looked more closely, i thought it might have been a plane because it was flickering and changing colors. i mean, brightly changing colors. red, blue, white, yellow...I've never seen a plane do that before. it also appeared to move a little,in small circles, but i couldn't be sure. it also appears to glow brightly and then fade within the space of a few minutes. if this is a star, i have never seen a star behave or appear that way before. my city is so well-lit that i can never see stars at night - i am skeptical that this is star. perhaps it's a satellite or something, but i felt scared and nervous and disbelief at the sight of this object. i just looked at my window and the object is still there, flickering away.
content.summary: Bright, flashing object - bright enough to be seen when other stars can't be seen.

content.detailedDescription:
On july 30 2009 i observed an unusually bright star in the southwest sky above joyce. i was forced to sleep in my car with my wife because there was no room to sleep in our friends trailor. i looked towards the sky, as i normally do, to look for ufos around 4:00 a.M. and there it was a bright star like light, about as bright as venus at its brightest. this was not venus though because i identified it in another part of the sky. 
what caught my attention was that the light was slowly moving. at first it moved down. i ran into the trailor and got a pair of binoculars. this confirmed to me that this was a single light and definetely not a plain or helicopter. a helicopter would have ran out of gas after the more than two hours i watched it. my wife and i watched the object move all directions. but it seemed to go back in forth in the same general area of the sky. we kept asking ourselves what they could possibly be doing. it look as if it was collecting air or possibly gaining energy from something. we knew that this was either extraterrestrial life forms or a secrest government agency using extraterrestrial technology. no known craft could have been doing the things we witnessed and would not have been doing them. we couldn't tell how large the object was or far away it was because it just looked like a star. we were completely intrigued by the ufo and could not take our eyes off it for the rest of the night. the only reason we lost track of it was because the light of the sun. 
the ufo was above the olympic mountain range in wa state where there is a suspected top secret underground military base. 
stewart wa
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: On july 30 2009 i was forced to sleep in my car with my wife. i noticed un unusually bright star in the southwest sky above joyce wa. i watched the object for 2 hours.

content.detailedDescription:
While driving north on hwy 41 in kings county north, close to fresno county line and about 10 miles south of lemore nas... i saw light as i was driving north in my car and those lights looked from a distance to be dancing and moving in a circular fashion...  flying vertically and 'dancing' with each other in a circular fashion...Lights i saw were two of them on each ufo and the color was there...One on each side for each ufo.... they would dance around in vertical fashion and move herky jerky in a circular flight path....
not a smooth flight path but quick movements and vertical to horizontal etc and back and forth...Etc.   awesome....
in conclusion, i feel that the et ufo were waiting for me and put on a show for me at the time..I opened the window on the passenger side and waved to the lead craft.   as soon as i waved to the lead craft the lead craft turned on another lite in the center of the craft and it was a large circular white light, pointed directly at me.  i smiled and greeted the craft with my meditation.   the two craft then left the area.  they seemed to join together and flew off north or up toward the nas. they became one light and flew away.   
the whole experience lasted about two minutes...
content.summary: Two craft...Withh lights on each end....I did not see any craft only lights..

content.detailedDescription: I step outside in my back yard to smoke a cig, and i noticed a bright star. red purplish in color. i thought it was a satellite because it was moving like one in a straight line (east). then as soon as i noticed it wasn't a star, it got a little brighter and then it slowly started to disappear. i saw it very dim for a few seconds then i couldn't see it anymore..After it was gone i was disappointing cause it left. could that be a a phenomenon of a satellite? i looked to see if there was any satellites over california at this time and the direction it was going but didn't find anything
content.summary: Bright light grows in intensity and then slowly disappears

content.detailedDescription:
10:37pm i was just now looking up into the sky hoping to see something from inside and it glided right over my place. i saw it clear as a bell. triangular shaped craft with three white outer lights and a flashing red center light just above the redwoods. it was not in the flight path of regular airplanes and it was silent. at first i thought i saw something way up star distance away that disappeared and then this came around from the other direction ( heading west then veering south ) just after that. then it disappeared past the tree line toward the ocean. it looked familiar. i saw one back in 1991 hovering above the trees in vermont. i was scarred back then but not this time.
now 10:52pm saw a shooting star due north coming from the direction the triangle went in. the skies were clear with no wind.
content.summary: Triangle three white lights one red flashing in center, no noise

content.detailedDescription:
I was walking across my parking lot, from my car to the door, and i looked up and saw an orange-yellow bright object moving in a straight line across the sky from the west to the east. i have a tendancy to look up at the sky at night to look at the stars and the night sky. i was not alerted to it by any noise. i would describe it as being a bright, star-like circle or sphere. it moved fairly quickly and made no noise. it was calm outside, no wind, and no traffic on the near-by street or in the parking lot to drown out any possible noise. 

about a minute after we started watching the object, it began blinking a reddish-orange light, but this was not visible until it was quite a distance away, leading me to believe the blinking light was located directly on top of it. it still made no noise, and there were no other lights associated with it. it did not appear to be an airplane or helecopter, because those generally have white, green, and/or red blinking lights. this object did not have any of that. i also could not identify a tail or rotating blades that i normally see with an airplane or helecoptor, even when spotted after dark. 

it was also very stable and smooth in its movement, meaning it did not appear to move side to side or up and down at all. it just went in a straight line. i'm not sure how high up it was, because all i could see was the sphere of light. when seen from a 90 degree angle, it was probably a quarter of an inch in diameter. we eventually lost sight of it over the trees across the parking lot.
content.summary: Yellow-orange star-like object move in a straight line across the night sky with no sound.

content.detailedDescription: I went out side with my fiancia and i look up to the sky like i always do and i notice a light moving in the sky heading south west so i went in side and got my fiancia to come look, then 2 more lights appeard in the sky following each other and were heading west. then the first ufo got real bright then went to its original lighting and kept heading on. then a light streaked across the the sky with fire behind it heading south west. we both freaked out and ran inside.
content.summary: 4 ufos in 1 minute

content.detailedDescription: On aug 5, 2009 i was sitting outside on the dock organizing fishing gear for a trip the next day. this was around the white marlin open tournament, i looked towards oc feris wheel and observed 3 lights in a triangular formation. i usually glance that way when outside at night. the lights appeared to move horizontaly at a very slow rate above the ferris wheel as a point of reference. i then went inside, and got my buddy and his wife. they too saw the lights. they thought it was weird.  they thought it was a aircraft. being familiar with aircraft i explained that those did not appear to be aircraft. i then thought they were military flares like the ones i have used, but the lights moved horizontally. after watching the lights for approx 20 min they faded out together. we all just looked at each other and shrugged our shoulders. we then went back to loading fishing gear when i looked back up to see the lights again in the same spot. the remained for about 10 min and dissapeared together. the night was clear with very little cloud cover. i was stunned to see something like that in ocean city . i was reluctant to report this at first. the inlet area was crowded, and thought somone else saw this too. i could not find any reports of this. however a few days later(friday) i did see a military boat on a trailer at the commercial docks in west ocean city. maybe they are flares, but i just don't know .My wife thinks i am crazy!
content.flightPath: Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Triangular shaped orange lights

content.detailedDescription:
Late evening sometime in october,maybe in the early part of nov of 2008. my long time girlfriend and i stayed up late. weather had been odd lately. she stepped outside for her cigarette. i stayed inside watching t.V.
she called me outside,she seemed excited. i assumed i was going to see a falling star or something. we stood and watched a white ball hanging over the north east sky. at first it didn't seem to be moving. then we realized it was moving slow. as it got closer it changed into a red circle not a disc that was made up of small red spheres. seemed kind of large really. didn't know what to think. it got closer overhead. it began to act as if it knew we were watching it.Not sure if it really did know. shape changed again while i was uttering "what the hell is that?" it began to resemble a small cargo plane or a two engine passenger plane. i said oh it's just a plane. although we had seen the shape change before that one for some reason this seemed logical. fuzzy headed really. i was shrugging it off and began to walk in. she stayed to watch ..Just to be sure. the loud noise of a small plane engine suddenly came on. i said "see it just a freaking plane." she was open mouthed "saying no way,no way is that a plane". i started acting cocky about it. i stood next to her again looking. making lame jokes. then it shot something green from the front end. it moved out fast like a rocket. the plane looking object stayed at the same speed for a about 3 seconds more then shifted into a straight line of white lights and caught up to the little green burning ball it had shot ahead of itself. then recollected into a small white ball. the grew a bit bigger all the while it moved slowly again toward the south east mountain line. the sound of the plane still present. almost as if the object forgot the sound behind itself leaving the sound over our house.  then the object drifted behind the mountain line out of view.
a month later a burning ball of white fire over those mountains appeared hovering. i saw it about 2 am while going to the bathroom i had an urge to look out the window. i went to the children's room to do that since their window is bigger. that is when i saw it. i watched it for about 5 minutes hanging there i was making sure it wasn't a star. then i ran down the hall to my girlfriend asleep in our bed. i woke her up and had her follow me to the boys room to see. i got her fast it seemed like maybe 30 seconds to 1 minute at the most. she got there and the object was gone. later i read on an online article that we had a ufo crash here in the 50's or 60's.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: N.E. sky, night. seen unexpectedly. sphere. changed shape.Circle,changed shape,mimic shape of airplane (cargo) loud sound. moved oddly for aplane. changed shape again,flew away over the mountain s.E.

content.detailedDescription:
At about 9:30 pm our satellite television started to break up it indicated a storm cloud or airplane.
i went outside to see,clear night.At that time i saw a  bright light through
the trees,at first i thought moon but it was too low.I rushed back inside and got my camera and ran to a spot where i could see the field where i saw the light.Running between two out buildings, i was four steps from seeing the
field at that time i observed a bright light moving away at great speed
toward the west or exactly toward kokomo in.It was the most beautiful of
colors vivid red inside, blue and white aura outside.Unfortunately i didn't
get any pictures.The moving light could have been meteor but i have never seen anything like that.The moon rose at over the trees in the east at 11:30
i live 7 miles from kokomo and this light seemed to go over the city.
no noise was apparent any time,the light when i first saw it through the trees was very bright and hard to look at,like a arc light.
content.summary: Very bright light through trees got camera ran to view saw bright light go west.

content.detailedDescription: I had a daytime sighting on an unidentified flying object this past weekend while at the beach (sandy hook, nj).  i decided to take a quick dip in the ocean, and was hanging out in the water and checking out the sky... there was a really cool rainbow halo (sun dog?) around the sun, due to the lightly overcast skies.  anyway, i was watching a commercial jetliner flying through the sun dog (which was to the west) and thought it was pretty cool... as i was watching it, i noticed a small dark object about 1/2 or 1 mile behind the plane at what seemed to be roughly the same altitude (maybe around 7k to 10k feet?  there is a lot of air traffic at this location due to the proximity to newark intl & ny area airports)... the object was small since it was pretty far away... it looked like maybe the size of a small pea at arms length.  it was small enough that i couldn't make out any significant details or features on it... besides the fact that it was a solid object.  it was round/discoid and maybe spherical (but not sure) and was moving erratically.  at first i thought "hmmm... wow is that a large bird flying/gliding in the thermals that high in the sky?"  but then the object did something that totally dispelled that theory.  it stopped flying and hovered in a wobbly fashion... and then it moved very quickly to the left (towards the south) and stopped on a dime... it then hovered for a couple of seconds again while looking all wobbly... and then shot back over the right (towards the north) by what i could guess was a few hundred feet almost instantaneously and stopped on a dime again and hovered while looking a bit wobbly... at this point i was asking myself "what the heck is this thing????".  then as it was hovering it did a star trek "warp speed" kind of acceleration in speed and flew downwards and then back up in a "u" shaped flight pattern and just shot off and disappeared!!!  when it did that i actually said out loudly "what the hell???? what was that?????" and there were a few people that were swimming in the water a few feet away from me that were looking at me like i was nuts.  i stood there for a minute or two looking up at the sky to see if it would come back, but it was gone... and it never came back.  at that point i rand out of the water to my wife to tell her what i saw.  i have tried to think of several different explanations of what this object could have been.  it was definitely a real, solid object and it seemed to be intelligently controlled.  it was not a bird, not a balloon, not anything that could ordinarily be explained.  i don't have any pictures or any evidence... just an explanation of what i saw... and i'm hoping that there were other reports from the area that would corroborate my sighting.
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Watched unidentified object flying erratically and very fast while on the beach and then shot off at "warp speed" and disappeared

content.detailedDescription:
I just went on their way home in the car .... when suddenly notice the plane and wanted to record it, but instead of recording a airplane...I record one ufo

was a ball that had a bright glow around him ..... it was very bright, somewhat fast, and great!Moved very weird .... it was something he had never seen and the video is reached alfinal hear a strange sound, a sound ..... the video captures what we can say luckily because i wanted to capture .... the plane reached a view on the bottom of the video, a flashing light was the small plane,  	
i felt very scared the truth, because i wanted to some day have the opportunity to capture a object like this, and so it happened accidentally grabs, what scares me so much at the moment sudden,
content.shape: Circle,  Disc,  Egg,  Fireball,  Oval,  Sphere,  Star-like
content.summary: Was a ball that had a bright glow around him

content.detailedDescription: Last night my wife and i were driving back from the airport from a vacation in florida.  we were headed east on the northern loop of 465.   we both were talking about our vacation events when we both looked at each other and said, "what the heck was that!".   the horizon of the sky was still barely lit up (it was almost 10 o'clock)   we were headed east and we saw what appeared to be helicopter or a flare in the distance.  it was noticable brigher than anything around it.  i had just assumed it was a star or maybe a planet.  then all of a sudden from it's motionless position in the sky it darted downward or north east extremely fast.  it almost looked like a shooting star, however i have never seen a shooting star start in a stationary position in the sky for at least ten seconds and then quickly dart downward in the sky.
content.summary: Ufo sighting off of 465 and ditch road

content.detailedDescription: Last evening as i was outside in my driveway talking to a friend on the phone, i looked in the sky to the north, and saw a very strange bright red light. it was moving to the northeast at a very slow rate, and was definately moving slower than any aircraft than i have ever seen. it seemed to flicker at times, but mostly was just a solid red/orange glow. at about 10:15 the sphere seemed to flash a little, and then a smaller sphere (same color as first) dropped from the first sphere and slowly descended to the ground. i lost sight of the smaller one as it dropped over the horizon. at that point the main sphere began to move in a more direct northwest direction, still moving slowly, and then it appeared to ascend for a second or two, then flashed bright white and dissapeared completely. i couldn't exactly determine how far this thing was, but it appeared to be between 5 to 10 miles away, and about 4000 feet above the ground. to say the least, it was a very strange event, and i have never seen anything like it before. i have attached pictures to this report, but they are from a digital camera, and not very close to the object. hopefully other people in this area saw the object as well. my wife took the photographs.
content.summary: Bright red sphere moving  slowly n/e then dropping smaller sphere.

content.detailedDescription:
In our tur august 01 2009 to neer by city (esbjerg-denmark)took we some pictures, few days later when i was transfering our pictures from my camera to our pc i find out there is something strange in right top corner of photo.

i,m not shore what it is, but i think it look like a ufo, would you please take a look at it and tell me what it could be.
content.summary: Just seen that in our picture

content.detailedDescription:
I am a 50 year old college lecturer from penzance in cornwall england, who with my wife pat were holidaying in north corfu and visiting my brother and sister in law who live there.

my wife, brother, sister in law and myself were driving back from a dinner party in kassiopi north corfu. the date was 29th july 2009 and the time 00.50(am). i was the driver and will add completely sober as were my passengers. we were heading to perithia village where my brother (david) and his wife (lyn) live. it was a clear and warm starlit night

as you leave kassiopi there is a long straight well lit stretch of road about 400 yards long after which there is a long stretch of bendy road. to my right is the ionian sea and albania to my left inland corfu which is a high hilly terrain.

as i left the town and entered the straight stretch of road i could see two very bright orange lights on the hill line and assumed them to be originating from lotses which is a large village up in the hills situated above perithia and thought no more about them.  i entered the windy stretch of road and drove through the little village of imarolia and drove up a slight incline away from the village which is followed by a long sharp left hand bend.  on completing the bend i then noticed in the sky above and in front of us 3 bright orange balls accompanied by a much larger (x 4/5 larger.  my brother who was in the passenger seat shouted out 'what the ...���.  everyone screamed stop the car which i did about 100 yards on just off the road.  we all got out of the car and assembled around it. i asked if anyone had a camera knowing mine was back at base in our beach bag.  unfortunately nobody did.  so we all watched the following events almost in complete silence apart from the odd shouts of 'did you see that' when something spectacular happened.  the objects did not emit any audible noise.

the three small lights at first appeared randomly spaced apart and were situated i would guess between roda (a town further along the road we were on) and mainland albania.  the larger light was above roda itself.  height is difficult to estimate, they were very high in the sky much higher than the neighbouring hills of corfu ad albania. all of the lights appeared stationery. 

the three smaller lights then positioned themselves into a straight line.  well apart from each other in an alignment away from us.  the larger light continued to hover well apart from the alignment. then the middle light of the line up of small lights moved outwards towards albania.  the nearest and rear aligned light moved inwards towards corfu and towards the furthest light to form a perfect delta shaped v.  they continued to hover for roughly 30 to 40 seconds.  the larger light remained unmoved during these manoeuvres. then the furthest away light started to move off away from us and was followed by the light nearest albania followed by the light nearest corfu. they moved away from us towards southern italy and appeared to ascend at the same time.  not straight up but at an incline at i would estimate at 45 degrees. all three lights were out of vision within twenty seconds. the larger light remained in its original position for about another 30 seconds or so before moving off in the same direction as the others disappearing again within twenty seconds on the same trajectory. 

the speed of the manoeuvres was terrific and perfect and the velocity of acceleration away from us was greater still.  i have watched 'the red arrows in england several times, this was nothing like that.  the speed they moved across the sky was much faster than anything i have seen at an air display and the acceleration out of view faster than anything i have seen at all.

we were filled with awe and disbelief during this spectacle and yet filled with excitement and euphoria to have witnessed this event.

i am not claiming that they were aliens; i just cannot explain what they were.  it s difficult to get across the speed these things carried out the display of movement and acceleration, i have seen nothing like this before..
content.flightPath: Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Sighting of three very bright orange lights accompanied by one much larger light

content.detailedDescription:
I reported a sighting last week to the national mufon site, of what i believe to be the same craft.  it was in the same place in the night sky last night, and looked the same.

i watched it for about 2 hours.  

it was a bright white light in the southern night sky, hovering.  it looked to be in our atmosphere, very big.  i called 4 of my neighbors out to see.  some cell phone video, and photos were taken.  they looked very low quality.  

it was definately the biggest, brightest thing, not a star, not a plane. it was stationary.  it got brighter at times, creating a halo effect.   at it's brightest it looked bright white,cigar shaped, with a white aura.

in my last sighting i didn't report it dimming, but it noticably dimmed this time.  when dimmed it was still very bright, but looked more like three light balls, the center slightly higher than the sides, sort of chevron shape.  

it moved to the right and higher at one point.  i never saw it move again.  after that it stayed stationary.  

i came in and filed a mufon report on the national site, and went back out to observe.  i watched for about two hours, and that is all i observed.  i called my friend, in indianapolis, and she observed it.  she also filed a report with mufon.  when i went to bed, i could look out the window, through the trees and still see the light hovering.  i don't know how long it was there, either sighting.
content.summary: Bright  white light, southern, hovering, at brightest  cigar shaped with light halo,  dimmed looked like 3 light balls

content.detailedDescription:
We were at dauphin lake.  there were 6 of us that witnessed the actual event.  i have it on video tape, although due to the camera not having been on night vision or anything like that, we are unable to see the object on the video.  although the audio of what happens works just fine.  the ufo was a large orange light that was going the direction of the shore line, and then it stopped, and went off in the direction away from us.  it moved very slowly before it shot off away from us.  at a speed i've never seen a plane move at.
dauphin lake is not on any flight paths.  the craft made absolutely no sound.  we were all pretty shocked.  no one suffered loss of time or anything like that though.  it was simply just a sighting of well we don't know what.
i live very close to the airport here in winnipeg, and i've seen many planes fly over the house.  they all make noise, if you can see them, you hear them.  this was completely silent.  there weren't even any animals making noises that night.  it was silent but for all of us well freaking out.
it was bright orange, not red like plane lights are red, white, blue even.  this was definitely orange, and a lot larger than plane lights are.  it wasn't a fire ball, there wasn't a storm, or any rain happening at the time of us seeing it.  i can be reached at my email address and can forward you a copy of what the camera did have on it.  i unfortunately do not know how to edit it to get whats on it to show up.  i just know that the lens cap was not on when he was shooting the video.  my husband had to run to the cabin to get the camera in the first place, but even though it said the cap was on, he had made sure it was not.  it was extremely dark out at the lake that night.
we were just sitting around by the camp fire.  i'm unsure of who noticed it first, but once we noticed it, we were all looking at it.  we knew it was not a plane, and well that makes it an unidentified flying object.
it was orange, moved very slowly, came to a stop and shot off in a zig zag pattern away from us.  faster than any plane i've ever seen it was gone from our sight in a couple of seconds.
our reactions are all on the video audio.  my feelings now are of this is important to tell people about.  that something not normal does exist.  was that man made?  i do not know, i'm leaving that up to professionals.
content.summary: It was orange moved slowly did a 90 degree turn and sped off away from us.

content.detailedDescription: At first my mother thought an airplane was going by, but then realized this "plane" was not leaving the area.  finally, she called my attention to it, i opened multiple windows, looking out and up.  i could not discern a source but observed a moderately loud rythmic sound of rushing air, cycling about every 30 seconds.   this lasted for at least eight minutes and ceased about two minutues prior to the arrival of the erie county sheriff's department and grand island fire department.  we had been experiencing off and on severe thunderstorms, but during the time of oberservation no storms were in progress in the immediate area and the air was nearly still, with a very high humidity.  conditions were overcast.  since we had just experienced severe storms i was concerned about possible utility line damage.  none has been discovered in the immediate area.  of note the sound was readily detectable inside the house with the windows closed and the central airconditioning running.
content.summary: Rythmic sound of rushing air not unlike that of a midwinter night, yet everything was still

content.detailedDescription:
I was relaxing in my backyard looking up at the stars.  i am an international long haul boeing 777 airline pilot, so i understand airplane lights and i am also familiar with atmospheric phenomena.  i have flown all over the world and am familiar with the night sky.  i am also a qualified microbiologist with a master's degree.  in a nutshell, what i am trying to say is that if something unusual catches my eye, i analyze it carefully and eventually am able to classify it rationally.

a bright red almost orange red light caught my eye far off in the ne sky.  it was moving in an easterly direction.  it seemed rather unusual, and i tried my best to look for other lights like a green right wing tip light that would help me identify it as an airplane.  there was no apparent engine noise, but that may be because it was far away.  it moved about through many different directions and all this time i was able to assure myself that there were definitely no other lights, only one red-orange light.  i called my wife and two boys (12 and 6) who also watched the event with me.  we watched it for at least 30 minutes from the time i first noticed it.  i tried to film it with my video camera, but could not capture it?  through my binoculars, it had definite solid spherical qualities like a solid red ball.  it did not flicker and glow like a flare.  at times it almost appeared to have a red spike protruding below it?  suddenly, a second smaller ball of the same color appeared to either fall from it or fly from it.  it went straight down towards the ground very slowly directly beneath the first ball of light until we lost sight of it on the horizon.

the first ball of light then appeared to gain altitude smoothly and reversed direction heading nw.  we continued to observe it and then noticed what appeared to be a faint bluish- whitish dim light appear to be on an intercept path beneath it.  we lost sight of this second very dim light.

suddenly there was a split second intensely bright white flash some distance beneath the first orange ball. the orange ball appeared to flicker?  a few seconds passed and i saw a second bright white flash and then without warning the orange ball flickered and disappeared.  i could not tell if it dematerialized or disintegrated or simply shot off so fast that i could not see it, but one second it was there and then the next it was gone.

the whole thing has left me slightly confused and irritated.  i am not one who thinks every light in the sky is a ufo, but i did feel that this observation was unusual and significant enough to report.  could it be a flare, i do not think so.  was it an airplane, definitely not!  maybe someone else also observed the same thing?
content.flightPath: Stationary,Path with directional change,Path then hovering
content.summary: Watched slow moving red -orange spere of definite solid almost perfect sphere/ball shape moving in easterly and then north westerly direction. a second sphere fell from it.  after two intensely white flashes some distance beneath it, it disappeared!
